message.content:
cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with a problem of guessing the value of a random variable based on yes/no questions, which is a classic problem in information theory (cs.IT). The use of an unreliable oracle and the analysis of the optimal strategy involve probabilistic considerations, which are also relevant to machine learning (cs.LG) and data structures (cs.DS). The paper also discusses a connection to the cutoff rate of the binary symmetric channel (BSC) with feedback, which is a topic in coding theory and complexity theory (cs.CC). Finally, the problem of guessing the value of a random variable based on questions can be seen as a form of inference or decision-making, which is a central topic in artificial intelligence (cs.AI).
